t:
When I flipped the magic coin for the first time, I wished for a child. The coin landed HEAD and a year later our son was born.

When I flipped the coin the second time, I wished for a bigger house. It landed TAIL and within a week my house burned down with my family inside.

When I held the coin for the last time, I dropped it half wishing for my family back, and half wishing that the coin never existed.

Years later, I'm still unsure what I want to hear; my son calling me ‘Dad’ once again or the coin hitting the floor.
